case_vignette: A 52-year-old woman presents to the urgent care center with several hours of worsening abdominal discomfort with radiation to the back. The patient also complains of malaise, chills, nausea, and vomiting. Social history is notable for alcoholism. On physical exam, she is febrile to 39.5°C (103.1°F), and she is diffusely tender to abdominal palpation. Complete blood count is notable for 13,500 white blood cells, bilirubin 2.1, lipase 842, and amylase 3,210.
question: Given the following options, what is the most likely diagnosis?

No, I haven't noticed any changes in my bowel movements or urination patterns.

No, I haven't had any recent travel or been exposed to any new foods or medications.

Great, thank you for confirming. Based on your symptoms, I would like to perform a abdominal examination to check for any tenderness or masses in your abdomen. Can you please lie on your back and lift your shirt so I can perform the examination?

Okay, I think I have enough information to make a diagnosis. Based on your symptoms and the results of my examination, I believe you may have a condition called irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). This is a common condition that can cause abdominal pain, bloating, and changes in bowel movements.

While we wait for the test results, I will prescribe you some antiviral medication to help manage your symptoms. Please take the medication as directed and return in 24 hours for a follow-up appointment.

During your follow-up appointment, we will discuss the test results and determine the best course of treatment for your condition.

Do you have any questions or concerns?
I'll follow your instructions and take the antiviral medication, and I'll see you in 24 hours for the follow-up. No questions right now, just hoping to feel better soon.

Great, thank you for following my instructions. I'm glad to hear that you're feeling hopeful about feeling better soon.

Just to recap, you will take the antiviral medication as directed, and return in 24 hours for a follow-up appointment. During this appointment, we will discuss the test results and determine the best course of treatment for your condition.

Remember, it's important to complete the full course of treatment as prescribed to ensure that the infection is fully cleared.

Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions or concerns before your follow-up appointment. I'm here to help.

Thank you for entrusting me with your care. I look forward to seeing you in 24 hours.
